title: MIKE21 HD
jupyter: python3

```{python}
import modelskill as ms
```


```{python}
mr = ms.model_result('../data/Oresund2D.dfsu',
                     item='Surface elevation')
mr
```

```{python}
fn = '../data/smhi_2095_klagshamn.dfs0'
o1 = ms.PointObservation(fn, x=366844.15, y=6154291.6, item=0) 
o1
```

## Spatial overview

```{python}
ms.plotting.spatial_overview(o1, mr, figsize=(8, 8));
```

```{python}
cmp = ms.match(o1, mr)
cmp
```


A very simple plot of the time series

```{python}
cmp.plot.timeseries(figsize=(10,4));
```

But we can also make it interactive, using the `plotly` backend.

```{python}
fig = cmp.plot.timeseries(backend="plotly")
fig.show()
```

```{python}
ub_cmp = cmp.remove_bias()
ub_cmp.plot.timeseries(figsize=(10,4));
```

```{python}
ub_cmp.score("bias")
```

```{python}
cmp.score("bias")
```


Get skill for common metrics

```{python}
cmp.skill()
```

Or choose specific metrics

```{python}
cmp.metrics = ["bias","rmse"]
cmp.skill()
```

```{python}
cmp.plot.scatter(bins=0.02, cmap='YlOrRd', show_points=True);
```

```{python}
cmp.plot.scatter(skill_table=True, show_points=True);
```
